##Requirments##

First you need to install azcopy. Download latest version [here](http://aka.ms/downloadazcopy "azcopy")

Change the storage account names and access keys in the script

Before you run the script you may have to set your execution policy to run the script, details can be found [here](https://social.technet.microsoft.com/Forums/ie/en-US/68af42d6-7a12-49eb-941c-72ba0cc6d316/setexecutionpolicy-unrestricted-force?forum=winserverpowershell "set execution ploicy") 

<kbd>> set-executionpolicy -executionpolicy unrestricted</kbd>

Now you can execute the script. I prefer to use <img  src="data:image/png;base64,"/> [powershell ISE](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/core-powershell/ise/introducing-the-windows-powershell-ise?view=powershell-6 "PowerShell ISE") as I can set breakpoint in the script.

or execute the script like this <kbd>> powershell.exe -executionpolicy unrestricted -command copyazurestorage-v1.ps1</kbd>
